definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: Interest rates and inflation are both due to climb.
sentences.chinese: 利率和通脹率都必定上升。

sentences.english: The risk is that higher headline inflation is misinterpreted as a sign that policy is too loose.
sentences.chinese: 真正的風險是高整體通脹被誤解讀成政策寬鬆的標誌。

sentences.english: Moreover, the economy was prone to slumps and episodes of hyperinflation.
sentences.chinese: 而且，當時的巴西經濟很可能出現蕭條或是極度通脹。

sentences.english: What is needed, therefore, is an analytical chapter on “over the horizon” risks.
sentences.chinese: 由此可知，通脹報告得補上一篇“地平線上的風險”。

sentences.english: Watch out, too, for what I'd call Inflation II.
sentences.chinese: 提防我所說的二次通脹。

sentences.english: An overheated economy can only exacerbate an incipient deterioration in inflationary expectations.
sentences.chinese: 經濟過熱只會使初顯惡化態勢的通脹預期進一步惡化。

sentences.english: China has turned decisively from being a deflationary to an inflationary factor in the world economy.
sentences.chinese: 中國已經決然地從世界經濟的緊縮因素變成通脹因素。

sentences.english: I expect food inflation to subside by early spring.
sentences.chinese: 我預測，今年早春時節，食品通脹就能消退。

sentences.english: It also tends to weaken the currency and increase inflation.
sentences.chinese: 它削弱了貨幣流通並提高了通脹。

sentences.english: Other indicators suggest food-price inflation could yet be contained.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些指標顯示食品價格通脹仍可控制。

sentences.english: At the same time pay demands take off and inflation re-emerges.
sentences.chinese: 同時，待遇要求開始上升，通脹重新擡頭。

sentences.english: As China overheats , inflation is picking up.
sentences.chinese: 隨着中國經濟的過熱，通脹開始擡頭。

sentences.english: Central banks can, of course, print more money, but that would stoke inflation.
sentences.chinese: 當然，央行可以加印鈔票，但這會加劇通脹。

sentences.english: They provide much better yields than ordinary Treasuries unless inflation disappears.
sentences.chinese: 它們提供比普通國債更好的收益率，除非通脹消失。

sentences.english: This opens the door for Chinese stocks that benefit from higher levels of inflation to outperform.
sentences.chinese: 這爲中國的通脹受益股走出強於大盤走勢開啓了大門。

sentences.english: And that's as good a segue as any to the inflation-vs.-deflation debate.
sentences.chinese: 而且，這也是通脹與通縮辯論的繼續。

definition: to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
